item.title: フランスの「ル・ジャーナル・デュ・ディマンシュ」紙が、億万長者による買収を前に、極右EICの任命に抗議してストライキを行った（Angelique Chrisafis/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Angelique Chrisafis / The Guardian:
Staff at France's Le Journal du Dimanche strike to protest the appointment of a far-right EIC, ahead of the key Sunday paper's acquisition by a billionaire  —  Public figures back strike at Le Journal du Dimanche to protest against appointment of Geoffroy Lejeune

item.title: ポーランド政府が2大ニュースサイトに影響を与えようとしたとの報道を受け、ポーランドの民間メディアが独立メディアを擁護する声明を発表（Daniel Tilles/Notes From Poland）
item.description:
Daniel Tilles / Notes From Poland:
Private media outlets in Poland issue a statement in defense of independent media, after reports the government sought to influence the two largest news sites  —  The editors of most of Poland's main private media outlets have issued a joint statement in defence of independent journalism.

item.title: 101人のファクトチェッカーと学者を対象とした調査で、87％がビデオ・ファクトチェックやグラフィックなどの新しいファクトチェック・フォーマットに関する研究を「非常に有用」または「有用」と考えていることがわかった（Angie Drobnic Holan/Poynter）
item.description:
Angie Drobnic Holan / Poynter:
A survey of 101 fact-checkers and academics finds 87% deem research on new fact-checking formats, like video fact-checks and graphics, “very useful” or “useful”  —  A recent survey received more than 100 suggestions for valuable research

item.title: オーストラリアのニュースメディア交渉規約に関する調査からカナダへの教訓が得られる：透明性の欠如、勝者と敗者を選ぶプラットフォームなどの問題（Diana Bossio/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Diana Bossio / Nieman Lab:
Research on Australia's News Media Bargaining Code offers lessons for Canada: issues like lack of transparency, platforms picking winners and losers, and more  —  “Our interviews showed that platforms were able to push for individual deals that aligned with their own business priorities.”

item.title: ネットフリックスとアマゾンの幹部は、英国のメディア法案はOfcomを「世界の警察官のようなもの」にし、小規模なストリーミング配信事業者に「逆インセンティブ」を生み出す可能性があると語っている（Max Goldbart/Deadline）
item.description:
Max Goldbart / Deadline:
Netflix and Amazon executives say the UK's Media Bill could make Ofcom “something of a global policeman” and create “perverse incentives” for smaller streamers  —  Netflix's latest attempt in its quiet campaign to soften the impact of the upcoming Media Bill took place …

item.title: 英国のリーチ社が、マンチェスター・イブニング・ニュースのプレミアム会員と並んで、ウェブサイトではなくアプリのみではあるが、初の従量制ペイウォールを開始した（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
The UK's Reach launches its first metered paywall, albeit only on the app and not the website, for the Manchester Evening News, alongside a premium membership  —  Reach may “explore premium options” with more of its biggest newsbrands if the trial is successful.

item.title: TikTokは、モンタナ州でのアプリ禁止に異議を唱えるTikTokクリエイターの訴訟に資金を提供したことを認めたが、同社がクリエイターに直接支払うことはないと述べている（Sapna Maheshwari/New York Times）。
item.description:
Sapna Maheshwari / New York Times:
TikTok admits to funding the TikTok creators' lawsuit in Montana challenging the state's ban of the app, but says the company is not paying creators directly  —  The popular video service had deflected questions about its involvement in the creators' lawsuit for more than a month.

item.title: Adalytics：~2020年から2023年にかけて、サードパーティーのサイトに掲載されたグーグルの動画広告の80％が、同社が約束した基準に違反していた。
item.description:
Patience Haggin / Wall Street Journal:
Adalytics: ~80% of Google's video ad placements on third-party sites violated the company's promised standards between 2020 and 2023; Google disputes the claims  —  About 80% of Google's video ad placements on third-party sites violated promised standards, new research shows; Google disputes claims

item.title: National PostとToronto Sunを発行するPostmedia Networkと、Toronto StarとMetroland Mediaを所有するNordstar Capitalが合併交渉中。
item.description:
Josh Rubin / Hamilton Spectator:
Postmedia Network, publisher of the National Post and Toronto Sun, and Nordstar Capital, owner of the Toronto Star and Metroland Media, are in talks to merge  —  NordStar, Postmedia would have 50% voting stake in a new company that would control most of the combined assets of both.

item.title: Paramount+とShowtimeが広告なしの月額11.99ドルで発売、広告付きのParamount+エッセンシャルプランは月額4.99ドルから5.99ドルに値上げ（Alex Weprin/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
Paramount+ with Showtime launches for $11.99/month, without ads; price of the ad-supported Paramount+ essential plan rises from $4.99/month to $5.99/month  —  The Showtime linear channel will continue for now, with eventual plans to rebrand it with Paramount+ programming.

item.title: ソースヴィレッジ・ヴォイス』誌と『L.A.ウィークリー』誌のCEO兼発行人であるブライアン・カールが『ペーパー・マガジン』誌を買収、復活を計画、元スタッフ数名と接触（Daniel Spielberger/Study Hall）
item.description:
Daniel Spielberger / Study Hall:
Source: Brian Calle, CEO and publisher of The Village Voice and L.A. Weekly, purchases Paper Magazine and plans to resurrect it, contacting some former staffers  —  The magazine has been purchased by Brian Calle, CEO and publisher of The Village Voice and L.A. Weekly.

item.title: 地域ジャーナリズムに対するカナダの税制優遇措置に関する報告書は、それが万能ではないことを明らかにし、いくつかの州が関連法案を提出する中で、米国が学べる教訓を探る（Sarah Scire/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Sarah Scire / Nieman Lab:
A report on Canadian tax incentives for local journalism finds they aren't a cure-all and explores lessons the US can learn as some states debut related bills  —  “There are other big questions hanging over the program, like whether it has actually helped stave off the collapse of newsrooms.”

item.title: アップル、SF番組「Silo」の第1話全編をTwitterで無料公開、Apple TV+でシーズン・フィナーレが放送される3日前に（Aisha Malik/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Aisha Malik / TechCrunch:
Apple offers the full first episode of Silo, a sci-fi show, to be viewed on Twitter for free, three days before Apple TV+ airs the show's season finale  —  Apple has uploaded the entire first episode of its sci-fi dystopian TV show “Silo” on Twitter, allowing anyone on the platform to view it for free.

item.title: TikTokが「TikTok Creative Challenge」を開始、5万人以上のフォロワーを持つ米国在住のクリエイターがブランド向けに動画広告を出稿し、パフォーマンスに応じて収入を得る（Aisha Malik/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Aisha Malik / TechCrunch:
TikTok launches the TikTok Creative Challenge, which lets US-based creators with 50K+ followers submit video ads for brands and make money based on performance  —  TikTok is introducing a new way for creators to earn money on its platform.  The company announced on Tuesday that it's launching the …

item.title: CWの番組チーフ、ケヴィン・レヴィは2006年のネットワーク立ち上げ時に入社したが、ネクスターがCWに刻印を押すため退社する（Kayla Cobb/The Wrap）
item.description:
Kayla Cobb / The Wrap:
CW programming chief Kevin Levy, who joined when the network launched in 2006, is leaving as Nexstar puts its stamp on The CW  —  The executive VP has been with the network since its 2006 launch  —  As Nexstar continues to put its stamp on The CW, another network staple is set to depart.
